Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you remove the blockchain that provides the security of the transactions, it isnt that big of a surprise that it isnt secure

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: WhiteWidow#8771
Content: Thanks for sharing your thoughts about this article guys

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it doesnt have any where the detail needed, but any channel based setup seems like it is really dependent on whoever controls the channel

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: without their good behavior, bad things happen, or at least it seems it can grind to a halt, which sort of messes up any speed gained

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and being dependent on a single node seems quite opposite to decentralizaion, whatever subset of traffic going through the channel is centralized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: independent chains dont have this issue, as it is an independent chain with all the blockchain logic to prevent censorship, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and independent chain just do their thing at normal speeds. combined, you get a big aggregate speed, but you have the problem of cross chain communication

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hence the MoM and MoMoM

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @polycryptoblog at Auckland Blockchain Meetup I had told Andreas Antonopolus about BarterDEX and it's Atomic Swaps tech, and while on the stage he still mentioned that there is no working atomic solution yet to his knowledge.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Soon after his talk I approached him and asked why he still said so where I explained to him the working progress of BarterDEX, and he said the issues like Transactions Malleability aren't yet solved to his knowledge.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'm not much sound on my blockchain internals and it's issues so I asked him to explain tx malleability in laymans terms and then told him that to my knowledge it's fixed in Barterdex tech.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: that evening I sent him couple of links, and the next day asked if he got a chance to take a look at those....

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: he's a busy man I agree, but I only understand they all are either Bitcoin Maximalist, or Ethereum or just not really being updated themselves with new updates on the tech solution
